 "owner": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "script": "frappe.ui.form.on(\"Material Request Plan Item\", {\r\n    custom_adjusted_qty: function(frm, cdt, cdn) {\r\n        let row = locals[cdt][cdn];\r\n        \r\n        if (row.custom_adjusted_qty && row.custom_adjusted_qty > 0) {\r\n            row.qty_as_per_bom = row.custom_adjusted_qty;\r\n        } else {\r\n            row.qty_as_per_bom = row.planned_qty;\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // Refresh the parent child table field (from Production Plan: mr_items)\r\n        frm.refresh_field(\"mr_items\");\r\n    }\r\n});\r\n",
 "view": "Form"
}
name: 1r03s6jffu

{
 "allow_guest": 0,
 "api_method": "get_segregated_materials",
 "creation": "2025-09-01 20:46:22.715777",
 "cron_format": null,
 "disabled": 0,
 "docstatus": 0,
 "doctype": "Server Script",
 "doctype_event": "Before Insert",
 "enable_rate_limit": 0,
 "event_frequency": "All",
 "idx": 0,
 "modified": "2025-09-01 20:50:51.024239",
 "modified_by": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "module": null,
 "name": "Get Segregated Raw Materials",
 "owner": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "rate_limit_count": 5,
 "rate_limit_seconds": 86400,
 "reference_doctype": null,
 "script": "production_plan_doc = frappe.form_dict.get("production_plan_doc")

# We check if production_plan_doc exists before running the code
if production_plan_doc:
    doc = frappe.get_doc("Production Plan", production_plan_doc)
    segregated_materials = []

    # 🚨 NOTE: This simplified script works for single-level BOMs.
    # It will not fetch raw materials from sub-assemblies.

    for assembly_item_row in doc.po_items:
        if not assembly_item_row.bom_no:
            frappe.throw(f"BOM not found for Assembly Item: {assembly_item_row.item_code}")

        # Manually get the BOM document
        bom_doc = frappe.get_doc("BOM", assembly_item_row.bom_no)

        # Check for BOM quantity to avoid division by zero
        if not bom_doc.quantity:
            continue

        # Calculate the multiplication factor for quantities
        factor = assembly_item_row.planned_qty / bom_doc.quantity

        # Loop through the items in the BOM's item table
        for bom_item in bom_doc.items:
            material_row = {
                "doctype": "Material Request Plan Item",
                "item_code": bom_item.item_code,
                # Calculate the final required quantity
                "qty_as_per_bom": bom_item.qty * factor,
                "parent_assembly_item": assembly_item_row.item_code
            }
            segregated_materials.append(material_row)

    # Send the final list back to the client script
    frappe.response["message"] = segregated_materials",
 "script_type": "API"
}

data: { "allow_guest": 0, "api_method": "pp_get_items", "creation": "2025-09-01 20:22:41.052140", "cron_format": null, "disabled": 0, "docstatus": 0, "doctype": "Server Script", "doctype_event": "Before Insert", "enable_rate_limit": 0, "event_frequency": "All", "idx": 0, "modified": "2025-09-01 21:04:27.728770", "modified_by": "jinga1094@gmail.com", "module": null, "name": "pp_get_items", "owner": "jinga1094@gmail.com", "rate_limit_count": 5, "rate_limit_seconds": 86400, "reference_doctype": null, "script": "def pp_get_items(doc): """ Receives a Production Plan document, explodes all BOMs for the items listed, and returns a flattened list of all required raw materials. :param doc: A dictionary representing the Production Plan document. :return: A list of dictionaries, where each dictionary is a required raw material. """ # Safely parse the document from the client-side JSON string production_plan = frappe.parse_json(doc) all_materials = [] # Ensure po_items exists and is a list if not production_plan.get("po_items") or not isinstance(production_plan.get("po_items"), list): return [] # Iterate through each item in the Production Plan's item table for pp_item in production_plan.get("po_items"): # Ensure we have the necessary data to proceed bom_no = pp_item.get("bom_no") planned_qty = flt(pp_item.get("planned_qty")) main_item_code = pp_item.get("item_code") if not (bom_no and planned_qty > 0 and main_item_code): continue try: # Fetch the BOM document and its 'items' child table in one go bom = frappe.get_doc("BOM", bom_no) # If the BOM is invalid or has no items, skip it if not bom or not bom.get("items"): continue # Get the quantity for which the BOM is defined (e.g., 1 unit, 100 units) bom_base_qty = flt(bom.for_quantity, 1) if bom_base_qty == 0: bom_base_qty = 1 # Avoid division by zero # Calculate the scaling factor for material quantities scaling_factor = planned_qty / bom_base_qty # Loop through each raw material item in the BOM for bom_item in bom.get("items"): required_qty = flt(bom_item.qty) * scaling_factor # Create a dictionary for this material with all the info the client script needs material_details = { "main_bom_item": main_item_code, # This is the key for grouping on the client "item_code": bom_item.item_code, "item_name": bom_item.item_name, "description": bom_item.description, "quantity": required_qty, "stock_uom": bom_item.stock_uom, "warehouse": bom_item.source_warehouse or pp_item.get("warehouse"), # Fallback to parent warehouse } all_materials.append(material_details) except frappe.DoesNotExistError: # If a BOM specified in the plan doesn't exist, log it and inform the user in the UI. msg = f"BOM '{bom_no}' not found for item '{main_item_code}'. This item will be skipped." frappe.log_error(msg, "Production Plan Material Fetch") frappe.msgprint(f"Warning: {msg}", title="BOM Not Found", indicator="orange") continue except Exception as e: # For any other unexpected error, log the full traceback and show an error dialog to the user. frappe.log_error(frappe.get_traceback(), "pp_get_items Error") frappe.throw(f"An unexpected error occurred while processing the BOM for '{main_item_code}'") return all_materials ", "script_type": "API" }

{
 "allow_guest": 0,
 "api_method": "pp_get_bom_items",
 "creation": "2025-09-01 16:12:11.032658",
 "cron_format": null,
 "disabled": 0,
 "docstatus": 0,
 "doctype": "Server Script",
 "doctype_event": "Before Insert",
 "enable_rate_limit": 0,
 "event_frequency": "All",
 "idx": 0,
 "modified": "2025-09-01 20:17:37.684332",
 "modified_by": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "module": null,
 "name": "pp_get_bom_items",
 "owner": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "rate_limit_count": 5,
 "rate_limit_seconds": 86400,
 "reference_doctype": null,
 "script": "# Server Script: pp_get_bom_items (Final Corrected Version)
# REMOVED: "import frappe" - This is not allowed and not needed in Server Scripts.

def pp_get_bom_items(bom: str, qty: float = 1):
    """
    Fetches raw materials from a BOM, calculates quantities, and returns them.
    """
    # Create a logger instance to see messages in the bench terminal
    log = frappe.logger("production_plan_api")
    log.debug(f"Starting to fetch items for BOM: {bom} with Qty: {qty}")

    try:
        # Step 1: Get the BOM's base output quantity
        # Use frappe.get_value for a more direct and efficient query
        bom_base_qty = frappe.db.get_value("BOM", bom, "quantity")

        if not bom_base_qty or bom_base_qty == 0:
            log.warning(f"BOM {bom} not found or its base quantity is 0. Returning empty list.")
            return {"items": [], "error": "BOM not found or its base quantity is 0."}

        # Step 2: Calculate the multiplication factor
        factor = frappe.utils.flt(qty) / bom_base_qty
        log.debug(f"Calculated factor: {qty} / {bom_base_qty} = {factor}")

        # Step 3: Fetch the exploded (flattened) items from the BOM
        items = frappe.db.get_all(
            "BOM Explosion Item",
            filters={"parent": bom},
            fields=["item_code", "stock_qty", "stock_uom"],
            order_by="idx"
        )

        # Fallback for simple BOMs
        if not items:
            items = frappe.db.get_all(
                "BOM Item",
                filters={"parent": bom},
                fields=["item_code", "qty as stock_qty", "uom as stock_uom"],
                order_by="idx"
            )

        log.debug(f"Found {len(items)} source items in BOM.")

        # Step 4: Calculate the required quantity for each item
        calculated_items = []
        for item in items:
            required_qty = frappe.utils.flt(item.get("stock_qty")) * factor
            calculated_items.append({
                "item_code": item.get("item_code"),
                "qty": required_qty,
                "uom": item.get("stock_uom")
            })

        log.info(f"Successfully processed BOM {bom}. Returning {len(calculated_items)} items.")
        return {"items": calculated_items, "debug": {"factor": factor, "source_rows": len(items)}}

    except Exception as e:
        # Log the full error to the server logs for debugging
        log.error(f"An exception occurred while processing BOM {bom}: {e}", exc_info=True)
        return {"items": [], "error": "An internal server error occurred. Check server logs for details."}",
 "script_type": "API"
}

 "enable_rate_limit": 0,
 "event_frequency": "All",
 "idx": 0,
 "modified": "2025-09-02 15:53:25.321398",
 "modified_by": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "module": null,
 "name": "Get BOM Operations",
 "owner": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "rate_limit_count": 5,
 "rate_limit_seconds": 86400,
 "reference_doctype": null,
 "script": "@frappe.whitelist()\r\ndef get_bom_operations(bom_no):\r\n    \"\"\"Get BOM operations for a given BOM\"\"\"\r\n    query = \"\"\"\r\n        SELECT \r\n            operation,\r\n            workstation,\r\n            time_in_mins,\r\n            description,\r\n            idx\r\n        FROM `tabBOM Operation`\r\n        WHERE parent = %s\r\n        ORDER BY idx\r\n    \"\"\"\r\n    \r\n    bom_operations = frappe.db.sql(query, bom_no, as_dict=True)\r\n    return bom_operations\r\n",
 "script_type": "API"
}
name: vc8q7iem2e

data:
{
 "creation": "2025-09-02 23:56:18.025775",
 "docstatus": 0,
 "doctype": "Client Script",
 "dt": "Production Plan",
 "enabled": 1,
 "idx": 0,
 "modified": "2025-09-03 00:21:34.088347",
 "modified_by": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "module": null,
 "name": "Employee name",
 "owner": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "script": "frappe.ui.form.on('Stitching Entry', {\r\n  employee(frm, cdt, cdn) {\r\n    const row = locals[cdt][cdn];\r\n    if (!row.employee) { row.employee_name = ''; frm.refresh_field('custom_work_table'); return; }\r\n    frappe.db.get_value('Employee', row.employee, 'employee_name').then(r => {\r\n      row.employee_name = r.message?.employee_name || '';\r\n      frm.refresh_field('custom_work_table');\r\n    });\r\n  }\r\n});\r\n\r\n",
 "view": "Form"
}
name: fh0htoikft

 ],

 "modified": "2025-09-03 01:07:12.861652",
 "modified_by": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "module": "Manufacturing",
 "name": "Stitching Work Summary",
 "owner": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "prepared_report": 0,
 "query": null,
 "ref_doctype": "Production Plan",
 "reference_report": null,
 "report_name": "Stitching Work Summary",
 "report_script": "# No imports used. Uses frappe and frappe.utils already available in the report sandbox.

# Normalize filters (trim keys like "duration ")
filters = { (k.strip() if isinstance(k, str) else k): v for k, v in (filters or {}).items() }

def get_from_to(flt_map):
    t = frappe.utils.getdate(frappe.utils.nowdate())
    duration = (flt_map.get("duration") or "This Week")
    if duration == "Today":
        return t, t
    if duration == "This Week":
        start = frappe.utils.add_days(t, -t.weekday())
        end = frappe.utils.add_days(start, 6)
        return start, end
    if duration == "This Month":
        start = frappe.utils.get_first_day(t)
        end = frappe.utils.get_last_day(t)
        return start, end
    # Date Range
    f = frappe.utils.getdate(flt_map.get("from_date") or t)
    to = frappe.utils.getdate(flt_map.get("to_date") or t)
    return f, to

def get_size_for_item(item_code):
    # Adjust these fieldnames to your actual size fields, or remove if not needed.
    vals = frappe.db.get_value("Item", item_code, ["length_cm", "width_cm"], as_dict=True)
    if vals and (vals.get("length_cm") and vals.get("width_cm")):
        l = int(frappe.utils.flt(vals.length_cm))
        w = int(frappe.utils.flt(vals.width_cm))
        return f"{l}x{w}"
    size_attr = frappe.db.get_value(
        "Item Variant Attribute",
        {"parent": item_code, "attribute": "Size"},
        "attribute_value",
    )
    return size_attr or ""

def make_chart(rows, period):
    p = period or "Day"  # Day | Week | Month
    buckets = {}
    for r in rows:
        d = frappe.utils.getdate(r["date"])
        if p == "Week":
            y, w, _ = d.isocalendar()
            key = f"{y}-W{w:02d}"
        elif p == "Month":
            key = d.strftime("%Y-%m")
        else:
            key = d.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
        buckets[key] = buckets.get(key, 0) + frappe.utils.flt(r.get("rate_per_unit") or 0)

    labels = sorted(buckets.keys())
    return {
        "data": {"labels": labels, "datasets": [{"name": "Amount (Rs)", "values": [buckets[k] for k in labels]}]},
        "type": "bar",
    }

# 1) Date range
from_date, to_date = get_from_to(filters)

# 2) Conditions
params = [from_date, to_date]
# Change pp.creation to your actual date field on Production Plan (e.g., posting_date)
conds = ["date(pp.creation) between %s and %s"]

if filters.get("employee"):
    conds.append("se.employee = %s")
    params.append(filters.get("employee"))

if filters.get("item"):
    conds.append("se.item_code = %s")
    params.append(filters.get("item"))

# 3) Fetch child rows
rows = frappe.db.sql(
    f"""
    select
      date(pp.creation) as date,
      se.employee,
      se.item_code,
      it.item_name as item_description,
      se.quantity,
      se.rate,
      se.amount
    from `tabStitching Entry` se
    left join `tabProduction Plan` pp on pp.name = se.parent
    left join `tabItem` it on it.name = se.item_code
    where se.parenttype='Production Plan'
      and {' and '.join(conds)}
    order by date asc, se.employee, se.item_code
    """,
    params,
    as_dict=True,
)

# 4) Transform
data = []
for r in rows:
    qty = frappe.utils.flt(r.quantity)
    total_pieces = int(qty)  # change if pieces != quantity
    amount = frappe.utils.flt(r.amount or 0)
    per_piece_rate = (amount / total_pieces) if total_pieces else 0
    size = get_size_for_item(r.item_code)

    data.append({
        "date": r.date,
        "employee": r.employee,
        "item_description": r.item_description,
        "size": size,
        "quantity_m": qty,
        "total_pieces": total_pieces,
        "rate_per_unit": amount,        # or use frappe.utils.flt(r.rate or 0) for unit rate
        "per_piece_rate": per_piece_rate,
    })

# 5) Output variables expected by Script Report
columns = [
    {"label": "Date", "fieldname": "date", "fieldtype": "Date", "width": 100},
    {"label": "Employee", "fieldname": "employee", "fieldtype": "Link", "options": "Employee", "width": 140},
    {"label": "Item Description", "fieldname": "item_description", "fieldtype": "Data", "width": 180},
    {"label": "Size (cm)", "fieldname": "size", "fieldtype": "Data", "width": 90},
    {"label": "Quantity (m)", "fieldname": "quantity_m", "fieldtype": "Float", "width": 110},
    {"label": "Total Pieces", "fieldname": "total_pieces", "fieldtype": "Int", "width": 110},
    {"label": "Rate per Unit (Rs)", "fieldname": "rate_per_unit", "fieldtype": "Currency", "width": 140},
    {"label": "Per Piece Rate (Rs)", "fieldname": "per_piece_rate", "fieldtype": "Currency", "width": 160},
]

result = data
chart = make_chart(data, filters.get("period"))",
 "report_type": "Script Report",
 "roles": [
  {
   "creation": "2025-09-03 00:56:30.984835",

   "owner": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
   "parent": "Stitching Work Summary",
   "parentfield": "roles",
   "parenttype": "Report",
   "role": "Manufacturing User"
  }
 ],
 "timeout": 0
}

 "query": "select\r\n  i.item_name as \"Cutting Item:Data:220\",\r\n  sum(sed.qty) as \"Quantity:Float:120\",\r\n  i.description as \"Item Description:Text:300\"\r\nfrom `tabStock Entry` se\r\njoin `tabStock Entry Detail` sed on sed.parent = se.name\r\njoin `tabItem` i on i.name = sed.item_code\r\nleft join `tabBOM` b on b.name = coalesce(se.bom_no, i.default_bom)\r\njoin `tabBOM Operation` bo on bo.parent = b.name\r\nwhere\r\n  se.docstatus = 1\r\n  and se.purpose = 'Manufacture'\r\n  and sed.is_finished_item = 1\r\n  and se.posting_date = curdate()\r\n  and bo.operation like 'Cutting%%'\r\ngroup by i.name, i.item_name, i.description\r\norder by i.item_name",

data:
{
 "allow_guest": 0,
 "api_method": "get_reports",
 "creation": "2025-09-03 17:41:19.435251",
 "cron_format": null,
 "disabled": 0,
 "docstatus": 0,
 "doctype": "Server Script",
 "doctype_event": "Before Insert",
 "enable_rate_limit": 0,
 "event_frequency": "All",
 "idx": 0,
 "modified": "2025-09-04 12:39:12.372418",
 "modified_by": "jinga1094@gmail.com",
 "module": null,
 "name": "report api",
 "owner": "Administrator",
 "rate_limit_count": 5,
 "rate_limit_seconds": 86400,
 "reference_doctype": null,
 "script": "# Name: get_daily_report
# Type: API

def execute():
    # ---- Stitching ----
    stitching_sql = """
    SELECT emp.employee_name AS employee,
           DATE(COALESCE(pp.posting_date, se.creation)) AS work_date,
           it.item_name,
           SUM(se.quantity) AS total_qty,
           SUM(COALESCE(se.amount, se.quantity*se.rate)) AS total_payable
    FROM `tabStitching Entry` se
    LEFT JOIN `tabProduction Plan` pp ON pp.name = se.parent
    LEFT JOIN `tabItem` it ON it.name = se.item_code
    LEFT JOIN `tabEmployee` emp ON emp.name = se.employee
    WHERE se.parenttype='Production Plan'
      AND DATE(COALESCE(pp.posting_date, se.creation)) BETWEEN CURDATE() AND CURDATE()
    GROUP BY emp.employee_name, work_date, it.item_name
    """
    stitching = frappe.db.sql(stitching_sql, as_dict=True)

    # ---- Cutting ----
    cutting_sql = """
    SELECT i.item_name AS cutting_item,
           SUM(sed.qty) AS quantity,
           i.description AS item_description
    FROM `tabStock Entry` se
    JOIN `tabStock Entry Detail` sed ON sed.parent=se.name
    JOIN `tabItem` i ON i.name=sed.item_code
    LEFT JOIN `tabBOM` b ON b.name=COALESCE(se.bom_no, i.default_bom)
    JOIN `tabBOM Operation` bo ON bo.parent=b.name
    WHERE se.docstatus=1
      AND se.purpose='Manufacture'
      AND sed.is_finished_item=1
      AND se.posting_date=CURDATE()
      AND bo.operation LIKE 'Cutting%%'
    GROUP BY i.name
    """
    cutting = frappe.db.sql(cutting_sql, as_dict=True)

    return {"stitching": stitching, "cutting": cutting}
",
 "script_type": "API"
}
